WRITING.TITLE: Led interior lights in my 09 Mazda 3. Paid $8 AUD ($5US) for the whole car. Massive improvement. Super bright with a modern look.
Mazda 3 2010 LED Glove compartment light replacement. Extremely difficult but well worth it.

WRITING.TEXT: Mazda 3 2010 LED Glove compartment light replacement. Couldn #8217;t find how to do this anywhere so here it is. 1: remove glove box door by unclipping the slow release hinge and pull out the two holders on either side. 2: remove inner lining using 3 clips at the bottom with a flat head screw driver (they are stubborn to unclip). 3: reach over the roof of the compartment (where the light is) and yank the bulb out of socket (use iPhone camera to locate where the bulb is as it #8217;s not visible). Don #8217;t be afraid to really pull it. By the way this is all in the most awkward position ever and can be difficult to see what your doing and manoeuvre the bulb out. 4: pull the wire down so it #8217;s visible and remove the halogen bulb. 5: Insert new led bulb and then do these steps in reverse.
Wish they looked this nice on the 2010 model. Mine are led but the lens makes them look weird.

Wow that #8217;s bad. Never had an issue with water getting into my lights or them fading or clouding. Although maybe check the the parking, and indicator bulbs, they could #8217;ve been damaged from the water seepage.

It was made using two led RGBW strip cut offs, 4 wires and the base of some t10 led globes for connection. I #8217;ve just plugged them into the parking globe socket. Drilled a small hole in the fog light housings (which have no fog lights annoyingly) for them to be routed up to the socket.

WRITING.TITLE: Put some LEDs in my lower reflectors and continuing with the LED theme.

WRITING.TEXT: Well they #8217;re both 3s I guess.

Got some cut offs from an led strip (mainly used for behind furniture and so on) that has white leds. Then soldered two wires to the positive and white connection (make sure to use tape to cover any bare wires. Then I removed the reflectors there is one screw behind them. Stuck the led strip underneath the reflector so it would shine up through it. Routed the cable through the smaller hole located behind the reflector. Pushed the reflector back down into place and screwed it back on. Then the other end of the wire was simply twisted around the metal prongs of the LED plate lights. Make sure to use electrical tape so it doesn #8217;t short out and blow a fuse. Also make sure you use some red sharpie on the led strip as Some of the white was visible towards the bottom of the reflector. Then your done. Was super easy. Also don #8217;t let soldering put you off, it #8217;s very easy and I #8217;ve only got a really cheap soldering iron. Only took I #8217;d say less than an hour for me. I really wanted those leds replacement reflectors so many people have but they don #8217;t make them for my AUS bumper so I made my own. [LED Lower reflector wiring](https://imgur.com/gallery/zlOThrj)

It #8217;s great. I love mine. Would #8217;ve wired them to the fog lights if I had any and had rear fogs. Still looks great like this and I #8217;m so glad I did it. They are so bright too. [Lower bumper LEDs](https://imgur.com/gallery/DnvgiZm)
This is the type of shit us Kmart workers have to deal with. Although I #8217;ve done it myself countless times.

WRITING.TITLE: LED DRLs done!

WRITING.TITLE: Newest to oldest, all white hatches.

WRITING.TEXT: Ahahaha. My IKEA car park is always almost empty.

Number plate bulbs and Parking globes were first. Super easy it #8217;s just a straight swap. On my gen 2 these are t10 leds. Interior lights use festoon globes (make sure you get the right sized ones) and they simply snap in once the lens is removed. Then I did the indicators. I used t20 amber leds with a t20 led resistor adapter so there #8217;s no need for splicing. Headlights where super easy and I would highly recommend the Nighteye brand as they #8217;re cheap, bright and reliable and this was a straight swap too. It #8217;s very easy. They #8217;re should be plenty of videos on the subject too. If you #8217;ve got a Gen 2 and you #8217;re stuck ask me Ive changed every globe imaginable to LED in my car. [LED indicator resistor](https://imgur.com/gallery/QE1X2Ak)
I never said that every generation of white hatch was there. All that I said was that they were all white hatches in oldest to newest order.

WRITING.TITLE: Bought some LED sequential indicators/DRLs. Only paid $15 AUD for them but they look great.

WRITING.TEXT: If only I could put them on but the other side was damaged in postage and doesn #8217;t work. Company should be sending out a replacement. So I #8217;ll have to stick with the boring indicators till it arrives. [These are the DRLs by the way](https://imgur.com/gallery/2763RjE)

https://rover.ebay.com/rover/0/0/0?mpre=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.ebay.com.au%2Fulk%2Fitm%2F233410989692 You could probably find some other ones if this isnt available in your country. If you #8217;re in Australia I #8217;d recommend these ones but there #8217;s plenty of competition on eBay. Just search LED sequential strip.

Same on this aftermarket model. It actually has a first blink larger than the rest. It #8217;s not an issue here in Australia because sequentials are legal so it #8217;s no problem for me but they #8217;ve catered for the US market with the first blink.
I removed my original globes and just slid the wire into the metal contact for the globe itself. With the globe in it looked stupid because they flashed out of time.
Slid it in between the bumper and headlights. Routed the wire up against the middle of the bumper/grill into the engine compartment. Wasn #8217;t too hard but it needed some encouragement.

Oh that #8217;s weird. I could only find switchback DRL and sequential models here in Australia. There #8217;s three wires from the strip. One is negative DRL, one is positive DRL and the last wire is positive indicator. So I just wired the DRL into my parking lights (since I turn them on every time I drive anyway), and the wire for the indicator I just slid under the metal contact for in the housing for the globe. I already had LED globes for my indicators previously so I already had resistors installed to stop hyperflash. I just used the plug and play resistors which plug into where the stock globe goes in and then on the other end of the resistor there is that same T20 led globe fitting (basically its like an extension cord with a resistor built in). The lights work great but unfortunately I have to wait to put them in as one of them was damaged in postage and I can #8217;t just have one on the front. I #8217;ll probably put up another post once I #8217;ve got them both in.
Every single time.
It #8217;s looking a little sad. At least it #8217;s stock.
They #8217;re always right where you need to walk. All that needs to happen a slight lapse in concentration and you #8217;ve walked into one.
I #8217;ve seen this exact car a few times in Zurich and I don #8217;t even live there #128514;
Wow. This is literally my worst nightmare.
Those are some interesting hub caps

I #8217;m also dying to get a sunroof. Got a 2010 sport with 50k miles and I #8217;d also rather not have to trade in. Seen some aftermarket ones and I #8217;m not sure its worth the price or if they #8217;re reliable. I #8217;ll probably just wait until I upgrade to get one I suppose.

WRITING.TITLE: Not too shabby.

WRITING.TEXT: I #8217;m pretty jealous of my mum. She #8217;s not far off buying a new Astina top trim (not sure what the US top spec is called). Fully loaded with the soul red paint, sunroof and red leather. I guess I #8217;ll just have to wait for now but my next car (most likely a Mazda) will definitely have a sunroof.

I #8217;d assume not. Probably needs the nuts tightened behind the lights. I #8217;m guessing there is a cover in the boot to access the back of the lights. Try tightening them up and see how that goes.

Just some cheap eBay white led strips (try get ones that are 6000k mine look a little too blue). Soldered some wired to the ends of all 4 and hooked it up to the parking lights original connection. You could also hook it into the battery to use them as DRLs but I turn my parking lights on every time I drive anyway so I didn #8217;t bother. I just used the 3M tape on the back to stick it to the trim and it stays on surprisingly well. May not be as simple for the SP25 or the US spec cars because I think you have different fog light housings and I know that the 2012+ definitely do. Nothing stopping you from sticking them on elsewhere. In total for 2 meters of led strip, wiring (which I ripped of some dead solar fairy lights) and the solder set me back $14 AUS which is like maybe $10 USD. Was pretty easy to install as well. Drilled a hole for each wire to go through in the panel and routed them up to the headlights to be wired in. Looks pretty stock too and not too tacked on looking since it conforms with the original trim that was there. [LED strip close up](https://imgur.com/gallery/2AIzOfG)
If it #8217;s anything like what they do here in Australia it #8217;ll be written off and you #8217;ll be getting money for a new one.
Probably could #8217;ve guessed. Hail seems to be just another one of our extreme weathers. Luckily I #8217;ve got a garage or I would #8217;ve had many insurance claims due to hail.
Ouch well that wasn #8217;t exactly avoidable.

WRITING.TITLE: LED switchback sequential DRL Mazda 3 2010

WRITING.TEXT: Got both on and working now. They are slightly out of time but for $15AUD ($10ish USD) I can #8217;t complain. Edit: signal only delayed whilst DRL is powered. So when my parking lights are off it works perfectly and is in time.
45cm. The DRL wires are tucked in the contacts for the parking lights no splicing. Same with the turn signal.
It #8217;s right in between the bumper and headlights. Sits flush most of the way, only had to cut some of the back portion out.
[LED SWITCHBACK SEQUENTIAL LINK](https://rover.ebay.com/rover/0/0/0?mpre=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.ebay.com.au%2Fulk%2Fitm%2F233207534682)
https://rover.ebay.com/rover/0/0/0?mpre=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.ebay.com.au%2Fulk%2Fitm%2F233207534682
https://rover.ebay.com/rover/0/0/0?mpre=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.ebay.com.au%2Fulk%2Fitm%2F233207534682

Also install was pretty easy. Shoved the strip in between the headlights and bumper. It #8217;s wired into the parking lights and turn signal, which to be honest is the easy part. You #8217;ve gotta be really careful when wedging the strip into the gab. Broke the first set by pulling the wires too hard. So install the strip and worry about the cable management afterwards.
Not sure actually. Have yet to take it out of the garage. I #8217;ll get back to you once I have.
I didn #8217;t have any stock DRLs on this. The lights down the bottom on the fog light housing are just led strips I wired into the parking lights.

https://imgur.com/gallery/0aI53m7 Day shot. Looks brighter in person and the angle was quite low too. Hard to show on camera but let #8217;s just say you #8217;re not gonna miss a bright amber sweeping led.

Yeah that #8217;s what I thought. Even if you don #8217;t like how the signal looks you can just use it as the DRL. Just be carful when you put them in. Where the wires are soldered to the strip is very fragile and I found that out with the first set I bought. Hope all goes well.
Me and my best mate are the same. I #8217;ve got a 2009 hatch and he #8217;s got a 2002 SP20 hatchback.
The second gen series 2 sport wheels are so nice. Honestly prefer them over the MPS ones.
Tried looking for them for ages but couldn #8217;t find any. Found a bargain on a set of 5 MPS ones instead though.
https://imgur.com/gallery/fAHqSSR I added some LEDs in my cup holders in my BL 2010 hatch. Matches well with the welcome lights.

WRITING.TITLE: Not exactly a garden enthusiast but this just looks depressing now. Stupid new council regulations meant they had to go.

WRITING.TEXT: Well yes considering we HAD to plant trees everywhere when the house was built. Pool was compliant when installed and now the trees have go to go. Can #8217;t make their minds up.
HOA?

Okay. Let #8217;s here the councils terrible reasons for us having to pay thousands to remove the trees. Kids may climb over the fence from neighbouring yards and use the tree to help them jump down into our pool area and potentially drown. I say if they can jump a 1.5 meter fence they can swim. Anyway not our fault they #8217;re trespassing it #8217;s the negligence of the parents. Our pool shed isn #8217;t compliant being where it is either is it has to have ridiculous fencing thrown all over the roof. Which I #8217;ll remove ASAP when the inspection is done.

It #8217;s sad too. We planted the trees from a tiny shrub to what they were prior to today. Well yes we can but they have to be 50cm away from the fence and and not overhang the fence by a height of 1 meter. So basically we #8217;re going to plant some nice screening hedges 50cm away from the fence with some standardised flowering trees (maybe gardenias or durantas) in front of that with some ground cover flowers underneath them all the way around the perimeter. It #8217;ll look nice once fully grown but that #8217;ll take years and not to mention thousands of dollars to buy.

Yeah I #8217;m not sure we were willing to go through all the hassle with fighting the council. Our whole streets gone through the same thing. Not only did the trees get cut down but most of the other plants have be shredded and trampled. It #8217;s just a rectangle full of water surrounded by a massive dirt and dead plant retainer. Sounds great doesn #8217;t it.
Oh righto, I don #8217;t believe that #8217;s a thing in Australia.

Sort of. They also take care of the bins, roads, parks, footpaths, as well as home safety regular like pool safety or property add ons or construction. Not so much based on aesthetics of people #8217;s homes like cut grass or trimmed hedges. Some people #8217;s houses look so overgrown you #8217;d think no one lived there, like they #8217;re beautiful houses but have been ruined by people who don #8217;t know how to look after their properties. Mainly foreigners who aren #8217;t used to owning homes and have family money.
Axella? Never heard of that in my life? What is it?
Oh righto. Yeah here in Australia it #8217;s called an MPS and not a speed3. Just thought Axela was a trim level or something. That #8217;s pretty cool to know.
Yes here in Australia it #8217;s called a Mazda 3 MPS. The gauges say MPS not speed. But otherwise they #8217;re the same as the US ones.

Also I think the only time I remember Mazda having trim levels shown on their cars here in Australia was on the BK SP23 and the BL SP25. Not sure you get those models in the US they #8217;re the top level trim for the 3 in Australia but they had a badge on the sides and back for the SP23 and only the back on the SP25.
Yeah that #8217;s right. Damn can #8217;t say I have the same eye for the rotaries I mainly know about the 323/3 and 626/6.

No we do not have the heated seats on the gen 2 at all no matter what trim. Although on the new Mazda 3 we get the heated seats and steering wheel on the top two trims as well as rear aircon vents across the range which the US and Canada doesn #8217;t get. I believe the heated steering wheel isn #8217;t even an option in Canada or US which is strange since we definitely don #8217;t need it here in Aus but it would make sense for you guys too get it.
Also quick question. What #8217;s the #8220;tech package #8221;. What does that get you over the non tech package model.

Yeah that #8217;s very confusing but it #8217;s no better with the AU models. That #8217;s pretty good compared to what we got, we never got the large head unit or the blind spot system. So this is our awful trim system for only the SP25 (which is the top trim/most expensive and had the 2.5L over the 2.0 the rest of the range had). 2010 had cloth seats and the small nav standard on the lowest trim. Middle trim got leather, Bose and small nav screen. (What I #8217;ve got) Highest got a sunroof, leather, Bose, and small nav. (So only a sunroof over the middle trim) 2012 (AKA the series 2 gen 2) got only one option for the SP25 which had a small nav, iPod USB in the centre console, leather, sunroof, Bose, push button start with proximity keyless entry, auto level HIDs, and better looking 17 inch wheels. The MPS 2010-2011. Just got what the middle spec Sp25 from 2010 did. No sunroof available either. And the MPS 2012-2013 got what the SP25 series 2 has minus the sunroof. So that #8217;s ours. Not including all the other models (the 2.0L ones) which gets even more confusing.

Nope. We didn #8217;t get HIDs at all up until 2012 (I #8217;ve put LEDs in mine anyway so it #8217;s just as bright) just wish I had the nice HID design of the headlights housing itself, mine have this massive ugly orange reflector which is for the US regulations they didn #8217;t bother to remove for our AU model which the HID ones had removed so it #8217;s a lot cleaner. The blind spot monitoring I wouldn #8217;t really care about too much to be honest. https://imgur.com/gallery/Izjudj7 Mine are the ones on the right which are the series 1 lights. Also shows the difference in bumpers between the series 2 and series 1. Ignore the LEDs they aren #8217;t stock*.

Yeah it #8217;s not gonna be very graceful or painless regardless. It #8217;s like that fact you guys can #8217;t have sequential indicators (excluding the mustangs) because not enough light is on at once and then they go and allow dim halogen red turn signals for the rear which I noticed after driving in the US really aren #8217;t easy to see compared to amber ones, they look like one of the brake lights is out for a second and then you realise they #8217;re turning. A lot of the US car design regulations should really be updated I think.
Yeah I always found that insane. Like whats the big deal?!
Nice and stock. Love those old school sport style sunroofs too. Great shot!
Ahahah yes. I find Mazda sunroofs have always been very reliable. I #8217;ve never had an issue with any of them.

WRITING.TITLE: Need some advice installing a spare tyre mounted Bose sub.

WRITING.TEXT: (I #8217;m not a car audio enthusiast I am not 100% sure what I need) I #8217;ve got a Bose spare tyre sub. Its got a built in amp. It #8217;s got 4 connectors that come out of it. I presume power for the amp and the audio input. Now obviously I #8217;d connect the power to 12v in my car. But I #8217;ve got a stock head unit and I #8217;ve done some research and I #8217;ve found out I need an LOC line output converter. Now I have no idea which one I would need at all. I #8217;d be getting the audio input from one of the rear speakers and need to convert it to be low from a high input. Do I need a powered LOC or a non powered model? Can I hook the power for the subs amp to my cig lighter or is that a terrible idea? Thanks, I hope someone understands what I #8217;m talking about.
Australia?

Nah it came out of a Mazda 3. It sounds good enough for me and fills the car okay. Need space in my boot and don #8217;t wanna spend a fortune. I #8217;ve got an aftermarket amp for it and it #8217;s sounds better than stock.
Ahahah yep. My dad has an Audi and it had one that looked almost identical.

WRITING.TITLE: Installed some led puddle lights and some illuminated door sills. (Video in description)

WRITING.TEXT: Both our parking spaces so that #8217;s not an issue.
https://youtu.be/yLB4zvaVsLQ

DIY. Just bought some #8220;eagle eye LEDs #8221; on eBay. It #8217;s basically a bolt with a built in led. Drilled a hole in the mirror and fastened it on with a nut on the inside of the mirror. Wires are run through the mirror, then the door card, through an empty grommet in the door and up through the A pillar to the interior lights in the ceiling. Wasn #8217;t really that hard. Door sill lights are connected to the same power and added some footwell lights in while I was at it using a piece of an LED strip.

Again they #8217;re our designated spaces in this complex. It #8217;s centred so it would be easier to remove the timber off the roof. Parking like this in everyday scenarios is just asking for someone to damage your car.

They are just the regular stock fog lights but I added some LED strips for daytime running lights. It #8217;s just the regular white led strips for kitchen lighting and behind furniture but I #8217;ve got it wired to the ACC power. They #8217;re just stuck on with the 3M tape on the back of the strips.
Apparently the word #8220;receipt #8221; is to common hence the underscore.

WRITING.TITLE: Mazda 3 2010 Maxx/3i Fog light install. Plus new dual colour LEDs.

WRITING.TEXT: Yeah I did. The wiring is all there. All you need are the fog lights and the switch. I had to replace the whole stalk as the switch is on there.
Bought all the parts from a wreckers off a wrecked Mazda 3 MZRCD 2010 (diesel Mazda 3 I think only Europe Australia and a few others got)
The design looks pretty similar tbh. More similar than I expected.
Those little projector led fog lights on the BN Mazda 3s are actually super bright and helpful.
They #8217;re way brighter than the normal sized massive fog lights. They project super well too.

Ahhh. I stupidly took the caps off the ends of the silicon so they #8217;d fit in between the bumper and headlight and water got it in. If you do this make sure to seal it. Mine rusted and lots of LEDs failed. If they #8217;re sealed up they should be fine. I #8217;m actually just in the process of ordering some right now when you sent the reply.
Did you tap into any fuses? That could be why. I messed with the fuses and got one at some point to but It just went away when I turned the car on and off.

I put mine in this 15 amp fuse at the very bottom of the row. https://imgur.com/gallery/wgJe8ZC Your fuse may have blown and could be related to some sort of engine computer. Mine is tapped in as shown in the photos. I definitely recommend tapping the lights into a fuse for something simple like interior lights or something similar. Can #8217;t remember what mine are tapped into but it #8217;s worked well for a while.

Try tap it into the fuse that I used. I don #8217;t see why that one you used would cause an engine light but it could be. I think all those fuses in the row you used are for the headlights and tail lights from memory. It will say on the bottom of the lid for the fuse box what each fuse does. I #8217;d have a look at that too.
Hmmm maybe try disconnect the battery and reconnect. There #8217;s also a reset thing you can do with the brake pedal to reset the cars engine computer. There should be tutorials online.

No problem glad I could help. I had the same issue a while ago. Also make sure the lights are sealed up well. I took the caps off the ends so they #8217;d fit better and they filled with water and rusted. If you do this make sure to seal them off and even if you don #8217;t make sure they #8217;re sealed well. I #8217;m about to order a new set to replace them.

It #8217;s just an LED RGB strip cut off soldered to some wire. The wires go around the sides of the headliner into the interior light wiring. It was pretty easy. I #8217;m slightly addicted to leds so I #8217;ve got a fair few on the car. https://imgur.com/gallery/K1OMXOl

He also had blue LEDs in the exterior door handles which I plan to do in the near future. I think the red might blend in a bit but you won #8217;t know until you try I guess.

I #8217;d have it hooked to the boot light power. I think the red light is for safety in the dark or something.

WRITING.TITLE: New LED door handle lights.

WRITING.TEXT: What #8217;s on the Ferraris headlight? Looks like stickers or something.

Made of just some cheap 5mm led bulbs with a 390 ohm resistor so they can be powered from a 12v power source, some speaker cable for the wiring and little LED bezels (which you don #8217;t really need and I #8217;d recommend not bothering with). You can pick up all the supplies from Ebay. I basically just drilled a small hole in the top of the door handle trim which just pops out with a screw and a couple clips. Fed the wires down into the electric window controls which is where I tapped the LEDs into. They run off the #8220;ON #8221; power position on they key and stay on while driving. I just tucked the legs from the wire into the harness contact as it #8217;s super tight instead of splicing wires. It was not too difficult. Didn #8217;t even have to remove the door card. Heres some more photos. https://imgur.com/gallery/kOcok7N
Tried to keep it looking OEM.
Why #8217;s that?

Yep same here. Bought everything within the week it was released. It #8217;s really annoying that such an expensive case would become so easily damaged.....
Is it this generation? My dad had one for a while in the early 2000s. https://imgur.com/gallery/g4v7pED
Ahhh righto. I did remember it looking different inside.
It was very expensive too. Cost me like $250 Australian. It #8217;s wayyy worse now. I could grab one of the corners that #8217;s coming off a bit and peel the whole back off if I wanted.

WRITING.TITLE: Mazda 3 BL factory BiXenon headlight upgrade. All went well and all bulbs are working.

WRITING.TEXT: Ahahah when doesn #8217;t it #128514;
No. You need to cut off the old connector and solder the new one in. It #8217;s just wire colour to colour. It #8217;s pretty easy.

Yeah I couldn #8217;t either. Had to figure out wiring on my own. The big grey connector the Xenon lights have doesn #8217;t fit the car which has a smaller connector. So i cut the smaller connector off the car and then I went to a scrap yard and cut off the Xenon connector from the car. I then soldered that too my car to replace the small connector. The wires match colour to colour. Then I plugged in the new headlights after soldering new connector in and they worked perfectly. [Xenon headlight wiring MZ3](https://imgur.com/gallery/pgFn7OA)

WRITING.TITLE: New Mazda to add to the family. 2020 Mazda 3 G25 Astina Kuroi.

WRITING.TEXT: Yep, GT top spec and it #8217;s all the accessories and options. All the interior bits too! Go big or go home #128514;
Yeah I agree. Those orange reflectors are awful. It #8217;s got a 360 camera with front and rear parking sensors. https://imgur.com/gallery/Qthvw2j

I think that #8217;s part of the 360 cam pack which is a driver sleep detection camera. So if you #8217;re sleeping or having medical issues it #8217;ll pull itself over with the hazards on or something like that.

Yeah you guys don #8217;t get much out there. Even some of the interior finishes aren #8217;t quite as good. Around you push button starter it #8217;s just cheap black plastic. We get chrome. Similar trim pieces like that seem worse on the US models. Small details but it #8217;s things I notice because I #8217;m a perfectionist #128514; also for some reason we get a bloody heated steering wheel in Australia and in the US and Canada you don #8217;t? Like what?!? #128514; you can see the button in it for this picture. https://imgur.com/gallery/wcWvamv
Only with interior lights. Yes it was optioned with the car so it would #8217;ve been included in the end price which was discounted once everything was added.

Yep in AUS. The plates are nice and thin. They #8217;re being replaced with the same plates but in black with white text so it matches the car better. We #8217;ve got hundreds of plate designs down here so you can have ones with sports teams on them, car brands, basically every colour and different country style plates that look like Euro/Jap/US ones. Pretty cool.

It ended up being around the $43k AUD mark. Mind you that #8217;s with basically all the options on it, brand new 2020 MY G25 ASTINA (top spec) with the Kuroi pack which isn #8217;t cheap either and is like $2500 on it #8217;s own.

Yeah the CX-30 is way more expensive. To be honest I didn #8217;t think that price is worth it. I know everyone is in love with SUVs but let #8217;s be honest here, the CX-30 is just a raised Mazda 3 and they #8217;re charging a hell of a lot more for it. Plus I think the 3 looks much better in my opinion.

Yeah it #8217;s really cool. Of course it comes at one of cost which isn #8217;t that cheap at like $300 AUD but you know it #8217;s yours forever. We do basically get the JDM spec cars down here because they #8217;re RHD so a lot of things carry over including names from Japan. I think they use the Astina name plate in Japan too. We got the 323 Astina in Australia (the protege5 in the US) and we #8217;ve had the Astina name here for ages at the top of the line model. For example on the 3 and Cx-30.
Yeah no ventilated seats here either #128546;. We do get the air vents though which is a massive plus. I don #8217;t think we #8217;re getting the turbo here in au....

Coming from a Mazda 3 BL 2010 everything feels familiar. The interior plastics scratch like hell so be careful there. The nav screen won #8217;t go into dark mode from factory so you have to do it using the dash brightness buttons to get it to go into auto. Otherwise its been smooth and easy to use. The 3 turbo would sell very well out here as you always see hot hatches around. GTIs, Rs, AMGs, Ms, you name it we have it. I really hope they bring it down here. We love hot hatches down under and I #8217;m always seeing them about.
Yeah not cheap. Makes a massive difference. A lot more sporty looking and makes the back end look less round and awkward I think.
Wait so you don #8217;t get AMG A classes? The MPS is an amazing car. Love them.

Yeah it #8217;s a ceramic paint protection. I believe it was dealer installed. It was included in the cost. Also got a dual blackvue dash cam installed through the dealer I believe that was also included.

I think it #8217;s a DR900s. I #8217;m honestly not sure sure what you can do to it. The factory Kuroi kit makes a big difference but it #8217;s expensive. I think the bonnet protector looks good for it too!

Wow! That #8217;s expensive. Is the GSL the base model? Could have something to do with on-road costs and tax. Maybe emissions tax or something like that? I know in Europe they #8217;re strict on that sorta thing.
Thanks. The colour is amazing! Tossing between white and red. Red managed to beat out the white. Had the white before so time for a change.
Ahahah that was a road trip 5 mins from home for a quick wash! With only 150kms on it the car has no idea what a road trip is! Holidays are coming up, and can #8217;t wait to take it away somewhere.

WRITING.TITLE: Factory Colour Navigation screen install BL 2010 hatchback.

WRITING.TEXT: Just installed the colour GPS nav screen in my BL maxx. Originally had a black and white basic screen which only showed fuel economy etc. $20 from the wreckers and the colour nav screen plugs straight in. Will need the steering wheel buttons to use nav however. Replaced the plastic steering wheel too with a nice leather one!
That #8217;s an aftermarket Eonon unit.

If you #8217;re basing that off the GPS location you #8217;d be wrong. I hadn #8217;t set it up and calibrated my location yet. That location was the smash repairs the wrecked car went to before the parts yard. But still it #8217;s not too far from where I #8217;m at.

Yeah in the Maxx sport and above so models like the SP25 etc. Neo and Maxx didn #8217;t get them. The middle screen where the radio usually is, isn #8217;t factory if you #8217;re looking at that. It #8217;s an aftermarket Eonon headunit.
Indeed it does have CarPlay but not android auto. [CarPlay](https://imgur.com/gallery/WdLmwvd)

Works pretty well. Overall happy with it and have only had a few small issues here and there. Carplay is pretty good but since IOS14 I need to restart the head unit to use carplay which is annoying. Reverse camera works pretty well. Also the steering wheel controls do all function correctly after the install and Bose system is compatible.

WRITING.TEXT: Just installed the SP25 side mirrors with built in indicators. Plug and play and overall an easy install. Now I #8217;ve got 4 side indicators for some reason #128514;
